Brawmy, the glimble-fogs did sweep  
Where sizzle-thrum dribbledees roam,  
Slinkis mirking in ringle-deep—  
Beware the Boombaloom!  

Wiffle your wish-hat, quick and snug,  
Grip grottle-stick close in your grip,  
Twizzle some ferno-dust to your mug—  
’Tis bumble-bonk on the slip!  

Crashity-clatter! The shadow slurks—  
Fluffleflash, Boombaloom blared!  
“They thrumble my thoughts, those echo-works,

Wiffle-hat perched with a pling,  
Underpass echoes now whittle and sigh—  
Brawmy, the glimble-fogs sing.

**Blustlewump in Murklemist**

Beware the brumblefog, my friend!  
The shushle-thick, the gloomle-gray!  
It swaffles up the endlet bend,  
And snurfles down the dray.

Frogsprogs slinker undergloom;  
I buckle on my bravelace vest,  
With floggle-stick and snoffleplume,  
Preparing for the quest.

Spludder-spatters, mistaglee,  
The blustlewump goes slithy-wide!  
Its nuzzlewhump goes ee-ee-ee,  
Its mumble-maws collide!

Dartleflash! With a vimflint spark—  
My floggle-stick, it zizzle-swings!  
The blustlewump shrieks, “Kwark! Kwark! Kwark!”  
And blump! To gloomle clings.

No more the brumblefog abides,  
No snorfle-murk, nor mistle-wail;  
The sunrise rizzles through the tides,  
And tale-spreads on the vale.

Rest now, traveller, brave and quick,  
With shushle's hush and dawn's bright kiss.  
Recall the blustlewump and stick  
That sailed the murklemist!

**Dreebeldawn and the Voodlebee**  

In flimmer-flecked and wobblewight,  
Bewibble winds did churn—  
Bewarn, dear child, the dreebeldawn  
Where voodlebees blurn!  
Their skipple-skraw pads dap and spin,  
In glim-glamming gait—  
Beware the wibble-whirring din  
That zoodle-zings fate!  

So donned I my quizzlequash cap,  
And buckled my gnashle-glee—  
I slung my glowber-thrusting zap  
To face the voodlebee.  
With gribberbones tucked 'neath my vest,  
And dribble-dotes sprigged—  
I braved the nuggle-nested nest  
Where swizzle-tails jigged.  

Out leapt the voodlebee—ClatterKREE!  
Its jawbles flashed and pealed—  
Its blink-blunk wings whirred shiverly  
As frangle-fangs revealed.  
I twisted, twailed, then turble-thwock!  
My zapper zanged a rune—  
The voodlebee gave one last squawk,  
Then flooped to skizzle-swoon.  

Triumphant throshes shimmer-flunned,  
My snaggled heart did sing—  
Homeward through twiggle-root I spun  
To jiggle-dance and spring.  
Now heed this tale when dreebeldawn  
Grows brilber-bright and dearn—  
Bewarn, dear child: where voodlebees blawn,  
Old echoes return!

**Mapwhingler’s March**

Beware the Mapwhingler! Scraggle-drawn,  
With skritchy leaf and flaptrap bite—  
The wimpling wrozzlemounds were pawn  
To blorzle blumps by glimly night.

O saggle not, nor flopple-beware!  
Let blatterboots do squiggle-trek,  
With grindle-comp and whophish stare  
To sniffle hazards left and neck.

Forth strode young Wimmick, chart in palm,  
His gobdle girt, his finchwig bright!  
"Zlizzle-klap!" The hedges calmed,  
He blinched the burble, faced the blight.

Around the chingle-splits he swept,  
While yappling shadows girched and yawed;  
Then—rasher-thrash!—the Mapwhingler crept  
And clatter-clawed, its drawnings gnawed.

"Spang! Chitter-skrat!" cried Wimmick bold,  
With whiggle-swirl and snarlersnap;  
He chartle-winged the beast of old,  
And clumped it flat beneath his map!

Back to glimly groves Wimmick skipped,  
With whophish tales and jingle-lore—  
The wrozzlemounds with wonder tipped  
His blatterboots, forevermore.

Beware the Mapwhingler! Scraggle-drawn,  
With skritchy leaf and flaptrap bite—  
The wimpling wrozzlemounds were pawn

**Wingsnicker's Whiffling**

Beware the flindle-woven wings,  
Where snufflenotes and whispers stir,  
The brandsome chitter-bramble sings,  
A dreeplish glooming whirr.

For here in shadow-flapper land,  
Skitterlings tiptoe on squibble-feet,  
They twitch the curtains, sly and grand,  
And minny-mutter, fleet.

O, gird your gleaming glimbleshade,  
Fold trumple-nerves inside your gaze,  
Don creakling boots by moths remade,  
And listen through the haze.

The Wingsnicker slorgles, sly and vast,  
A flickertongue of chilly sneer,  
With gigglerust it slathers past—  
You bumble near with fear.

But swash your feather-fangled blade!  
Cry "Snashle! Frongle! Skree!"  
The Wingsnicker’s cackle’s sharply frayed—  
You twizzle, wild and free.

Br-rumple! Bleedle! Thwack and shriek,  
Its glollop-wings snap in defeat,  
With dingle-spin and brambly beak,  
You spring upon swift feet.

So spangle back through wings’ faint light,  
Past flickershade and drindle-hue,  
Now all the shadow-sprites take flight—  
The stage belongs to you.

Yet still the flindle-woven wings  
Where snufflenotes and whispers stir,  
Remember brandsome chitter-brings  
The dreeplish glooming whirr.

**Brunebrumble’s Butterglee**

Beware the Brunebrumble, my frothling friend,  
With snickersnip tail and crispity claws!  
It whifflestirs runcid from pan to the end,  
In nutnuzzle nights where the browner-bread gnaws.

Mixle not rashly, nor skittle the flame,  
For sssizzle the spittles that slappuddle near—  
Brim-scorched and shaggled, it spluckles your name  
From bottle to bowl with a whirrsting leer.

I whisked up my courage, dentooned my dull spoon,  
And flumphed through the butterish splatter and spree—  
Burbly the bubbles began their braboon,  
While Brunebrumble snickered: “But not catching me!”

Its sniffletongue flickered sly gold to the rim,  
I brandished my spatgrip with flupping aplomb,  
And swirled the slick burble—its snappet turned slim—  
Till the Brunebrumble yowled, then was gone with a bomb!

O crisple and crackle! Zingfizz in the air!  
Skiddoodle the sizzle, shimmutter the cheer!  
With butterglee bubbling in bread everywhere,

So, shunned be Brunebrumble, my frothling friend,

Shook every blumblebee.  

With a skrabble-swash and a muffle-blam  
I clobbered doff and don—  
Ploof-zam! It twizzled, flopped and slam!  
The Drumblewair was gone.  

Back home I lurkled, wefting light,  
Through glimmerfuzz and fog;  
Twelve whizzle-bells sang gleeful-bright,  
Upon the moffle log.  

O wifflewhush, the mistle yarn  
Still glimble in the gloam,  
Yet snicker-free, the dewling dawn  
Now snozz-warms up my home.

**The Brindlebright Buzzlebane**

Beware the Brindlebright, my chum!
